document.docAuthor: Saturnino, Regiane, Tourinho, Ana Lúcia & Azevedo, Clarissa Salette De
document.masterDocTitle: Catalogue of type specimens of invertebrates in the collection of the Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas da Amazônia, Manaus, Brazil. IV. Arachnida: Acari, Palpigradi, Pseudoscorpiones, Ricinulei and Schizomida

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Catalogue of type specimens of invertebrates in the collection of the Instituto Nacional de Pesquisas da Amazônia, Manaus, Brazil. IV. Arachnida: Acari, Palpigradi, Pseudoscorpiones, Ricinulei and Schizomida

subSubSection.paragraph:
Holotype : female, INPA-PS 48 ; Brazil , Amazonas, Manaus , Reserva Florestal Adolpho Ducke, Km 26 Manaus – Itacoatiara Highway (AM-010) (Kempson Extraction), J. Wellington de Morais leg.,
10 .V. 1983
. Paratypes : tritonymph, INPA-PS 49 ; deutonymph, INPA-PS
50, 08
.IX. 1982 ; same details.

Holotype : male, INPA-PS 51 ; Brazil , Amazonas, Rio Urubu (ca. 02° 10 ' 5 S,
49 ° 59 'W
), on
Cocytius duponchel Poey, 1832 (Lepidopt.)
, P.F. Bührnheim et al. leg. Paratypes : male,
2 females
, and tritonymph, INPA-PS 52 ; same details.

Remark :
Mahnert & Aguiar ( 1986 )
gave the sampling date as 8 –9.1983, but the label with the holotype states
08–09.VIII. 1983
.

Holotype : female, INPA-PS 454 ; Brazil , Amazonas, Manaus , J. Adis leg.,
02.VIII. 1977
(canopy fogging, 24 A).

Holotype : female, INPA-PS 23 ; Brazil , Amazonas, Manaus , Tarumã Mirim , Igapó, in Bromeliacean (
Streptocalyx poeppigii
), J. Adis leg.,
29–31 .X. 1980
. Paratypes : male,
2 females
, and 7 tritonymphs, INPA-PS 24 ; same details; female, INPA-PS 407 ; Km 60 N Manaus ,18.1 km e Campinas field station (
02° 30 'S
,
60 ° 15 'W
), canopy fogging, Montgomery, Erwin, Schimel, Krischik, Date and Bacon leg.,
22 .II. 1979
.

Remarks : Although
Mahnert ( 1985 )
did not include the female INPA-PS 407 in the type material list, he labeled it as paratype . This specimen is herein considered to hold paratype status following article 72.4.1.1 of the International Code of
Zoological Nomenclature ( 1999 )
.

n. sp

Remarks : In
Mahnert ( 1979 )
there are
5 males
,
43 females
, 3703 tritonymphs and 9 deutonymphs listed after the holotype designation. This material was not cited as paratype in original publication. According to the author the paratype of this material has been lost (Volker Mahnert, in litt .). INPA-PS 365 – INPA-PS 405 were formally deposited at INPA , however, they are labeled only as
Tyrannochthonius
n. sp
. The species author confirmed that all deposited material referred to this species and labeled as n. sp . are paratypes (Volker Mahnert, in litt .).

Remarks : Although
Mahnert ( 1985 )
designed only one male paratype collected by J. Wellington de Morais at Tarumã Mirim between
1982–1983
there are two males fitting his descriptions and labeled as paratypes (INPA-PS 452 and INPA-PS 453 ). Eight other specimens (
4 females
and 4 deutonymphs) were labelled as paratypes by the author, but not listed in the material examined. These specimens are all considered herein to hold paratype status following article 72.4.1.1 of the International Code of
Zoological Nomenclature ( 1999 )
.

09.II. 1977

06.VII. 1978
.

Remarks:
Mahnert ( 1979 )
designed one male and two females with the same locality and collector as paratype above (INPA-PS 54 ), but in
Mahnert ( 1979 )
the sampling date is
26 .V. 1978
whereas on the label it is
06.VII. 1978
. This female is herein considered to hold paratype status based on article 72.4.1.1 of the International Code of
Zoological Nomenclature ( 1999 )
.
